[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in opening sentences (e.g., "Sea her, town THE where-grey on up blue stretch the BEGINNINGS Alps")
[LEXICON]: Overly complex vocabulary may hinder smooth reading for some readers (e.g., "embowered", "gadding", "fopperies")
[GRAMMAR]: Occasional missing articles and inconsistent punctuation

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from descriptive passages to historical events without clear connectors
[CLARITY]: Overly dense historical context may confuse readers unfamiliar with the period
[TRANSITION]: Sudden shift from Parisian gossip to the protagonist's personal life without smooth bridging

[SYNTAX]: Awkward sentence structure in "At the end of six months he called again upon Boucher, his sketches under his arm; and this time he was not sent away." (Lack of clear transition)
[LEXICON]: Overly complex vocabulary for general readability (e.g., "consummate master", "large-hearted")
[GRAMMAR]: Missing article in "painted them, day by day, from memory." (Should be "painted them day by day from memory" or with articles for clarity)

[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition from Fragonard's training to the Director-General's death and its consequences
[CLARITY]: Unclear timeline in the sequence of events (e.g., the exact timing of Fragonard's work with Boucher and his own projects)
[TRANSITION]: Lack of smooth connection between Fragonard's artistic development and the political events described
